title.value: Vesicular trafficking is a key determinant of the statin response in acute myeloid leukemia
title.justification: The title directly states the main focus of the research, which is the role of vesicular trafficking in the response to statin treatment within the context of acute myeloid leukemia.
title.quote: Vesicular trafficking is a key determinant of the statin response in acute myeloid leukemia

extractions.description: This research paper investigates the mechanism by which statins influence acute myeloid leukemia (AML) cell viability, particularly focusing on the role of vesicular trafficking as a key determinant in the statin response. It identifies the role of protein geranylgeranylation and RAB proteins in mediating these effects and explores statins' potential as therapeutic agents for AML.

type.justification: The paper involves experimental data detailed in sections like 'Methods' and 'Results and Discussion', which implies an empirical approach.
type.quote: Viability assays were performed as described. ^{11} Whole-genome CRISPR/Cas9 screening Screening was performed as described.

name.justification: The paper is focused on studying statin response in acute myeloid leukemia (AML), highlighting it as a potential therapeutic target, which places it within the field of cancer research.
name.quote: Cholesterol homeostasis has been proposed as one mechanism contributing to chemoresistance in AML and hence, inclusion of statins in therapeutic regimens...

name.justification: The paper discusses molecular mechanisms, such as vesicle-mediated trafficking and protein geranylgeranylation, involved in AML.
name.quote: genetic screening to identify modulators of the statin response uncovered the role of protein geranylgeranylation and of RAB proteins...

name.justification: The study of how statins affect AML, including their role as inhibitors and their pharmacokinetics, aligns with pharmacology research.
name.quote: Statins are competitive inhibitors of HMGCR, the rate-limiting enzyme in the mevalonate pathway.

name.justification: The study used SynergyFinder for analyzing the synergy between statins and other treatments in AML cells.
name.quote: analyzed using the R (v3.6.1) SynergyFinder (v2.0.12) package

is_contributed.justification: SynergyFinder is not a contribution of this paper; it is an existing tool used for analysis within the research.
is_contributed.quote: analyzed using the R (v3.6.1) SynergyFinder (v2.0.12) package

is_executed.justification: The paper mentions using SynergyFinder as a tool to analyze data but does not specify it was executed in terms of machine processing.
is_executed.quote: analyzed using the R (v3.6.1) SynergyFinder (v2.0.12) package

is_compared.justification: The paper does not mention comparing SynergyFinder to other models or tools within its context.
is_compared.quote: analyzed using the R (v3.6.1) SynergyFinder (v2.0.12) package

referenced_paper_title.value: SynergyFinder: a web application for analyzing drug combination dose-response matrix data
referenced_paper_title.justification: SynergyFinder is an existing tool mentioned in the context of this paper, thus the referenced paper associated with its development is cited.
referenced_paper_title.quote: analyzed using the R (v3.6.1) SynergyFinder (v2.0.12) package

name.justification: The Leucegene cohort is referred to multiple times as a source of primary human AML specimens used in the study.
name.quote: Results for statin-sensitive specimen 09H113 are representative of 12 primary human AML specimens (supplemental Figure 5)

referenced_paper_title.value: A novel approach for the identification of efficient combination therapies in primary human acute myeloid leukemia specimens
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper uses the Leucegene cohort for AML specimens, as mentioned in other works related to the AML specimen studies.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Results for statin-sensitive specimen 09H113 are representative of 12 primary human AML specimens (supplemental Figure 5)

name.justification: The R language was used in the analysis process within this research.
name.quote: analyzed using the R (v3.6.1) SynergyFinder (v2.0.12) package

referenced_paper_title.value: R: A language and environment for statistical computing
referenced_paper_title.justification: The use of the R language and environment for statistical analysis is well-documented and cited properly in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: analyzed using the R (v3.6.1) SynergyFinder (v2.0.12) package
